intro: Mentha × verticillata f. pycnodonta, commonly known as narrow-leaf water mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist environments such as stream banks, wet meadows, and damp woodlands. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses.
